Quiz.Title: Football Trivia Quiz
Quiz.Description: Test your football trivia and see how good you are!

Questions.QuestionText: Which player has played in a Super Bowl with three different teams?

Answers.Explanation: Rod Woodson got to the Super Bowl three times: 1995 with Pittsburgh; 2000 with the Baltimore Ravens, and again in 2002 with the Raiders.
While Tom Brady has played in seven Super Bowls (winning four of them as of 2017), they've all been with the New England Patriots.
Anquan Boldin has been in two Super Bowls with two different teams - the Baltimore Ravens (2012) and the Arizona Cardinals (2009).
John Elway has lead his team to five Super Bowls - but that team has always been the Denver Broncos.

Questions.QuestionText: Which of the positions below is a defensive position?

Answers.Explanation: The wingback is a halfback position that pre-dates the flaker wide receiver.
The slotback is also known as the slot receiver, who appears between the split wide receiver and the last offensive linemen on that side of the ball.
The gunner is not technically a position, but a role played on special teams. After a punt, gunners try and cover the punt receiver right as he catches the ball to prevent a run-back.
Not only a terrible Canadian band, a Nickelback is an extra defensive halfback used to cover additional receivers.

Questions.QuestionText: Which city below has had a professional football team the longest?

Answers.Explanation: The 49ers started in 1946 - The Kansas City Blues were established in 1924.
The Baltimore Colts were established in 1947, and played there until 1983. The Kansas City Blues were established in 1924.
The first professional football team in Kansas City were known as the Kansas City Blues, and they were established in 1924.
The Boston Braves was the first professional football team in Boston, starting in 1932. They moved to Washington in 1937 and became the Redskins. The Kansas City Blues were established in 1924.

Questions.QuestionText: NFL Teams moving cities are a reality of professional sports in this day and age. Which team below has moved cities the most?

Answers.Explanation: The Titans started out as the Houston Oilers, then became the Tennessee Oilers, based in Memphis, then became the Tennessee Titans after moving to Memphis. That's a lot of moving, but not as much as the Colts.
The Kansas City Chiefs started out as the Houston Texans in 1960 in the AFL, but relocated to Kansas City  in 1963 where they've stayed put ever since.

The Colts have a complex history, going through many names and cities along the way. They started off as the Dayton Triangles in 1913, subsequently to Brooklyn as the Dodgers, then changing their name to the Tigers, then moved to Boston as they merged with the existing Boston Yanks, then moved back to New York as the Bulldogs in 1949 before being named back to the Yanks in 1950 after another merger. The team was dissolved and replaced by the Texan in 1951 before that team was dissolved and the Yanks came back - this time as the Baltimore Colts (the second iteration). The Colts moved to Indianapolis overnight in 1984.
The LA Rams have moved from Cleveland, to Los Angeles, to St. Louis and back to Los Angeles. That's a lot of moving but not as much as the Colts.

Questions.QuestionText: Who holds the record for the longest field goal?

Answers.Explanation: Adam was a good kicker, but his longest was 57 yards. The longest is 64 yards.
Close - but incorrect. Janikowski has hit from 63 yards, whereas the record stands at 64.

Wayne Walker is not a distance man; he holds the unfortunate title of the lowest percentage FG kicker in NFL history (40.5%). He played for Detroit from 1958 to 1972. However, he was also a Linebacker so it's a bit unfair to judge him against today's specialists.
The thin mile-high air at Denver likely aided Matt in setting this record, but it stands at 63 yards, set in 2013.

Questions.QuestionText: Madden NFL is a long-running, beloved football simulation video game that has been around since the late 1980's. Starting in 1999, each iteration of the game features a cover star. Which NFL player has NOT appeared on the cover of the Madden video game franchise?

Answers.Explanation: The Steeler safety appears alongside Cardinals wide-out Larry Fitzgerald in 2010's Madden.

As one of the most successful quarterbacks of our era, one has to imagine Tom has received offers from EA to appear as the cover star - but he has not. Perhaps he wants to avoid the Madden Curse, or maybe it conflicts with his Uggs sponsorship.
Vick appeared on the cover of Madden 2004 prior to his federal dog-fighting conviction. His speed in that version of the game was untouchable - ranked as the fastest player on the field (98/100)

While mostly an NFL bust, Vince Young rode a successful college and early NFL career at Texas to a Madden cover in 08. His career took a nosedive due to injury that year and Vince never fully returned to form (although he did do well in 2009), causing much speculation about the Madden Curse.

EndScreen.SharingLabel: What score will your friends get?

Messages: PRACTICE SQUAD - You don't have what it takes!
SPECIAL TEAMS - Not bad - your knowledge shows, but you need to try harder to make the cut
STARTER - You've got a high football IQ!.
MVP! MVP! - 100% correct - you're a football genius.
